TitleAlt: Ake no chō, 明けの蝶
creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by H. Ed Robison, in memory of his beloved wife Ulrike Pietzner Robison
medium: Woodblock print, ink and color on paper
signed: bottom margin, in pencil: [明けの蝶 (ake no chō) / 60/100 / Chizuko Yoshida 1978]
text: In Butterflies at Dawn, the cool-toned butterflies evoke shimmering water under early summer sunlight, with a band of pale rose at the top suggesting the soft morning glow. In contrast, Butterflies—Swarming shifts from deep magenta to coral pink, as butterflies soar toward a golden sky, symbolizing the seasonal transition from summer to autumn. The scattered yellow butterflies can be seen as drifting leaves, reinforcing nature’s cycle of change.
title: Butterflies at Dawn
